oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-07-07 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-07-07 (as dated on disc label, announcement on the 1956-06-30 show suggests this show may have aired 1956-07-10 instead) part 1. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Bern Bennett, starring Sam ""The Man"" Taylor and his orchestra, and featuring Clyde McPhatter, the Platters, Della Reese, and Sugar & Spice. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sam "The Man" Taylor; Della Reese; Clyde McPhatter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Station announcement -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Alan Freed) -- Opening statement (Bern Bennett) -- Alan Freed introduces Sam ""The Man"" Taylor and the orchestra -- Take One (Sam ""The Man"" Taylor and orchestra) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Della Reese -- Headin' Home (Della Reese) -- Alan Freed introduces Clyde McPhatter -- Money Honey (Clyde McPhatter) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Clyde McPhatter -- Treasure Of Love (Clyde McPhatter)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; WCBS (Radio station : New York, N.Y.); R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Bennett, Bern, 1921-2014; Taylor, Sam; Reese, Della; McPhatter, Clyde; Platters (Musical group); Williams, Tony, 1928-1992; Sugar & Spice (Musical group); Melamed, Louis; Sears, Al, 1910-1990; Henry, Haywood
